Authors:
Motoaki Tojo, Masaki Uchida, Satoshi Imura, Shota
Masumoto
Title:
Morphological and molecular characterization of Rhytisma
filamentosum sp. nov. from Nagano Prefecture, Japan
Keywords:
Rhytisma filamentosum, tar spot, Salix integra,
morphology, rDNA
Abstract:
We describe a new fungal species, Rhytisma filamentosum,
which causes tar spot disease on Salix integra in Nagano Prefecture,
Japan. Its most distinctive morphological features are asci and
ascospores that are distinctly longer than those of other Rhytisma
species on Salix. rDNA ITS and LSU sequence analyses also indicate that
this fungus is sufficiently distinct from other Rhytisma species to
justify new species status.
